description: Number of multisets associated with least integer of each prime signature.
comments: a(n,k) multiplied by A036038(n,k) yields A049009(n,k).a(n,k) enumerates distributions of n identical objects (balls) into m of altogether n distinguishable boxes. The k-th partition of n, taken in the Abramowitz-Stegun (A-St) order, specifies the occupation of the m =m(n,k)= A036043(n,k) boxes. m = m(n,k) is the number of parts of the k-th partition of n. For the A-St ordering see pp.831-2 of the reference given in A117506. _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 13 2007.The sequence of row lengths is p(n)= A000041(n) (partition numbers).For the A-St order of partitions see the Abramowitz-Stegun reference given in A117506.The corresponding triangle with summed row entries which belong to partitions of the same number of parts k is A103371. [From _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 11 2012]
links: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
Wolfdieter Lang, First 10 rows and more.
formula: a(n,k) = A048996(n,k)*binomial(n,m(n,k)),n>=1, k=1,...,p(n) and m(n,k):=A036043(n,k) gives the number of parts of the k-th partition of n.
crossrefs: Cf. A103371(n-1, m-1) (triangle obtained after summing in every row the numbers with like part numbers m).
author: _Alford Arnold_
